page.title: 09THE MINEHEAD HOBBY HORSE
page.content: The M.H.H.is a Mayday custom. It is said that long ago the people of Minehead frightened away Danish invaders by showing them the frenzied horse. It does not look like a horse but more like a covered boat frame for is was the sailor men of the old Quay Town who introduced the custom. The horse is a frame of withy sticks about 8 feet long carried on a man's shoulders whose body and legs are concealed by loose hanging sacking all round which are painted circles and "the Sailor's Horse". The head is in the centre- a grotesque painted tin mask.Hundreds of ribbons cover the top of the framework and a long lashing tail completes the horse.The horse is accompanied by a drummer and a melodian player who play "Soldiers Joy" an old folk tune.
